content.text: Now let me examine the GitHub workflow file to understand the configuration:

content.content:
/Users/tarive/Desktop/CADS/CADS-Visualizer/.github/workflows/security.yml
/Users/tarive/Desktop/CADS/CADS-Visualizer/.github/workflows/ci.yml

1→name: CI/CD Pipeline
     2→
     3→on:
     4→  push:
     5→    branches: [ main, develop ]
     6→  pull_request:
     7→    branches: [ main ]
     8→
     9→env:
    10→  NODE_VERSION: '18'
    11→  PYTHON_VERSION: '3.9'
    12→
    13→jobs:
    14→  test:
    15→    name: Run Tests
    16→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    17→    environment: cads-research
    18→    
    19→    services:
    20→      postgres:
    21→        image: postgres:14
    22→        env:
    23→          POSTGRES_USER: postgres
    24→          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres
    25→          POSTGRES_DB: test_db
    26→        options: >-
    27→          --health-cmd pg_isready
    28→          --health-interval 10s
    29→          --health-timeout 5s
    30→          --health-retries 5
    31→        ports:
    32→          - 5432:5432
    33→
    34→    steps:
    35→      - name: Checkout code
    36→        uses: actions/checkout@v4
    37→        with:
    38→          fetch-depth: 0
    39→
    40→      - name: Set up Python
    41→        uses: actions/setup-python@v4
    42→        with:
    43→          python-version: ${{ env.PYTHON_VERSION }}
    44→          cache: 'pip'
    45→          cache-dependency-path: 'requirements.txt'
    46→
    47→      - name: Set up Node.js
    48→        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    49→        with:
    50→          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
    51→
    52→      - name: Install Python dependencies
    53→        run: |
    54→          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
    55→          pip install -r requirements.txt
    56→
    57→      - name: Debug environment
    58→        run: |
    59→          echo "Python version: $(python --version)"
    60→          echo "Current directory: $(pwd)"
    61→          echo "Requirements file check:"
    62→          ls -la requirements.txt
    63→          echo "CADS directory check:"
    64→          ls -la cads/ || echo "CADS directory structure may differ in CI"
    65→          echo "Project structure:"
    66→          ls -la
    67→
    68→      - name: Set up test environment variables
    69→        run: |
    70→          echo "DATABASE_URL=postgresql://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/test_db" >> $GITHUB_ENV
    71→          echo "SUPABASE_URL=${{ secrets.DATABASE_URL }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
    72→          echo "OPENALEX_EMAIL=test@example.com" >> $GITHUB_ENV
    73→          echo "GROQ_API_KEY=${{ secrets.GROQ_API_KEY }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
    74→          echo "CI=true" >> $GITHUB_ENV
    75→
    76→      - name: Generate comprehensive test data
    77→        run: |
    78→          echo "🔧 Generating comprehensive test data for CI environment..."
    79→          python3 scripts/ci/generate_test_data.py
    80→          
    81→          echo "📋 Verifying generated files..."
    82→          ls -la data/processed/
    83→          ls -la visuals/public/data/
    84→          
    85→          echo "📊 File sizes:"
    86→          find data/ visuals/public/data/ -name "*.json" -exec ls -lh {} \;
    87→          echo "📦 Compressed files:"
    88→          find data/ visuals/public/data/ -name "*.gz" -exec ls -lh {} \;
    89→          
    90→          echo "✅ Comprehensive test data generated successfully"
    91→
    92→      - name: Run comprehensive test suite
    93→        run: |
    94→          chmod +x .github/scripts/run-tests.sh
    95→          ./.github/scripts/run-tests.sh
    96→
    97→  deploy:
    98→    name: Deploy to Vercel
    99→    needs: test
   100→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   101→    environment: cads-research
   102→    # Only deploy if tests pass AND we're on main branch AND it's a push (not PR)
   103→    if: success() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
   104→    
   105→    steps:
   106→      - name: Checkout code
   107→        uses: actions/checkout@v4
   108→
   109→      - name: Verify test job succeeded
   110→        run: |
   111→          echo "✅ All tests passed successfully - proceeding with deployment"
   112→          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
   113→          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"
   114→
   115→      - name: Debug Vercel configuration
   116→        run: |
   117→          echo "🔍 Verifying Vercel environment variables..."
   118→          echo "VERCEL_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
   119→          echo "VERCEL_ORG_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_ORG_ID != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
   120→          echo "VERCEL_PROJECT_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_PROJECT_ID != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
   121→          echo "Environment: cads-research"
   122→
   123→      - name: Install Vercel CLI
   124→        run: npm install -g vercel@latest
   125→
   126→      - name: Deploy to Vercel
   127→        run: |
   128→          echo "🚀 Starting Vercel deployment..."
   129→          
   130→          # Verify required environment variables
   131→          if [ -z "$VERCEL_TOKEN" ]; then
   132→            echo "❌ VERCEL_TOKEN is not set"
   133→            exit 1
   134→          fi
   135→          
   136→          echo "✅ Vercel token is set"
   137→          
   138→          # Deploy to create fresh cads-research project 
   139→          echo "🚀 Creating fresh cads-research project..."
   140→          
   141→          # Remove any existing .vercel directory to ensure clean deployment
   142→          rm -rf .vercel
   143→          
   144→          # Unset the problematic environment variables
   145→          unset VERCEL_ORG_ID
   146→          unset VERCEL_PROJECT_ID
   147→          
   148→          # Deploy with specific project name - this will create the project
   149→          echo "🚀 Deploying fresh cads-research project..."
   150→          vercel --prod --token "$VERCEL_TOKEN" --yes
   151→        env:
   152→          VERCEL_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN }}
   153→
   154→      - name: Health check
   155→        run: |
   156→          echo "🏥 Running post-deployment health check..."
   157→          echo "Checking URL: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}"
   158→          
   159→          # Wait for deployment to be fully available
   160→          sleep 30
   161→          
   162→          # Test main page
   163→          echo "Testing main page..."
   164→          curl -f -s "${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}" > /dev/null || exit 1
   165→          
   166→          # Test data endpoint
   167→          echo "Testing data endpoint..."
   168→          curl -f -s "${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}/data/visualization-data.json" > /dev/null || exit 1
   169→          
   170→          echo "✅ Deployment health check passed"
   171→
   172→      - name: Deployment success notification
   173→        run: |
   174→          echo "🚀 Deployment completed successfully!"
   175→          echo "URL: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}"
   176→
   177→  # This job runs when tests fail to provide clear feedback
   178→  test-failure-notification:
   179→    name: Test Failure Notification
   180→    needs: test
   181→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   182→    if: failure() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
   183→    
   184→    steps:
   185→      - name: Test failure notification
   186→        run: |
   187→          echo "❌ Tests failed - deployment blocked!"
   188→          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
   189→          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"
   190→          echo "Please fix the failing tests before deployment can proceed."
   191→          exit 1
   192→
   193→  # Summary job that always runs to provide final status
   194→  summary:
   195→    name: Pipeline Summary
   196→    needs: [test, deploy]
   197→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   198→    if: always()
   199→    
   200→    steps:
   201→      - name: Pipeline summary
   202→        run: |
   203→          echo "📋 CI/CD Pipeline Summary"
   204→          echo "======================="
   205→          echo "Test Status: ${{ needs.test.result }}"
   206→          echo "Deploy Status: ${{ needs.deploy.result }}"
   207→          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
   208→          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"
   209→          
   210→          if [[ "${{ needs.test.result }}" == "success" ]]; then
   211→            echo "✅ Tests: PASSED"
   212→          else
   213→            echo "❌ Tests: FAILED"
   214→          fi

file.content:
name: CI/CD Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

env:
  NODE_VERSION: '18'
  PYTHON_VERSION: '3.9'

jobs:
  test:
    name: Run Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    environment: cads-research
    
    services:
      postgres:
        image: postgres:14
        env:
          POSTGRES_USER: postgres
          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres
          POSTGRES_DB: test_db
        options: >-
          --health-cmd pg_isready
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 5432:5432

    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v4
        with:
          python-version: ${{ env.PYTHON_VERSION }}
          cache: 'pip'
          cache-dependency-path: 'requirements.txt'

      - name: Set up Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}

      - name: Install Python dependencies
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          pip install -r requirements.txt

      - name: Debug environment
        run: |
          echo "Python version: $(python --version)"
          echo "Current directory: $(pwd)"
          echo "Requirements file check:"
          ls -la requirements.txt
          echo "CADS directory check:"
          ls -la cads/ || echo "CADS directory structure may differ in CI"
          echo "Project structure:"
          ls -la

      - name: Set up test environment variables
        run: |
          echo "DATABASE_URL=postgresql://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/test_db" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "SUPABASE_URL=${{ secrets.DATABASE_URL }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "OPENALEX_EMAIL=test@example.com" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "GROQ_API_KEY=${{ secrets.GROQ_API_KEY }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "CI=true" >> $GITHUB_ENV

      - name: Generate comprehensive test data
        run: |
          echo "🔧 Generating comprehensive test data for CI environment..."
          python3 scripts/ci/generate_test_data.py
          
          echo "📋 Verifying generated files..."
          ls -la data/processed/
          ls -la visuals/public/data/
          
          echo "📊 File sizes:"
          find data/ visuals/public/data/ -name "*.json" -exec ls -lh {} \;
          echo "📦 Compressed files:"
          find data/ visuals/public/data/ -name "*.gz" -exec ls -lh {} \;
          
          echo "✅ Comprehensive test data generated successfully"

      - name: Run comprehensive test suite
        run: |
          chmod +x .github/scripts/run-tests.sh
          ./.github/scripts/run-tests.sh

  deploy:
    name: Deploy to Vercel
    needs: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    environment: cads-research
    # Only deploy if tests pass AND we're on main branch AND it's a push (not PR)
    if: success() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Verify test job succeeded
        run: |
          echo "✅ All tests passed successfully - proceeding with deployment"
          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"

      - name: Debug Vercel configuration
        run: |
          echo "🔍 Verifying Vercel environment variables..."
          echo "VERCEL_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "VERCEL_ORG_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_ORG_ID != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "VERCEL_PROJECT_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_PROJECT_ID != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "Environment: cads-research"

      - name: Install Vercel CLI
        run: npm install -g vercel@latest

      - name: Deploy to Vercel
        run: |
          echo "🚀 Starting Vercel deployment..."
          
          # Verify required environment variables
          if [ -z "$VERCEL_TOKEN" ]; then
            echo "❌ VERCEL_TOKEN is not set"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          echo "✅ Vercel token is set"
          
          # Deploy to create fresh cads-research project 
          echo "🚀 Creating fresh cads-research project..."
          
          # Remove any existing .vercel directory to ensure clean deployment
          rm -rf .vercel
          
          # Unset the problematic environment variables
          unset VERCEL_ORG_ID
          unset VERCEL_PROJECT_ID
          
          # Deploy with specific project name - this will create the project
          echo "🚀 Deploying fresh cads-research project..."
          vercel --prod --token "$VERCEL_TOKEN" --yes
        env:
          VERCEL_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN }}

      - name: Health check
        run: |
          echo "🏥 Running post-deployment health check..."
          echo "Checking URL: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}"
          
          # Wait for deployment to be fully available
          sleep 30
          
          # Test main page
          echo "Testing main page..."
          curl -f -s "${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}" > /dev/null || exit 1
          
          # Test data endpoint
          echo "Testing data endpoint..."
          curl -f -s "${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}/data/visualization-data.json" > /dev/null || exit 1
          
          echo "✅ Deployment health check passed"

      - name: Deployment success notification
        run: |
          echo "🚀 Deployment completed successfully!"
          echo "URL: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}"

  # This job runs when tests fail to provide clear feedback
  test-failure-notification:
    name: Test Failure Notification
    needs: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: failure() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    
    steps:
      - name: Test failure notification
        run: |
          echo "❌ Tests failed - deployment blocked!"
          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"
          echo "Please fix the failing tests before deployment can proceed."
          exit 1

  # Summary job that always runs to provide final status
  summary:
    name: Pipeline Summary
    needs: [test, deploy]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: always()
    
    steps:
      - name: Pipeline summary
        run: |
          echo "📋 CI/CD Pipeline Summary"
          echo "======================="
          echo "Test Status: ${{ needs.test.result }}"
          echo "Deploy Status: ${{ needs.deploy.result }}"
          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.test.result }}" == "success" ]]; then
            echo "✅ Tests: PASSED"
          else
            echo "❌ Tests: FAILED"
          fi
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.deploy.result }}" == "success" ]]; then
            echo "✅ Deployment: COMPLETED"
          elif [[ "${{ needs.deploy.result }}" == "skipped" ]]; then
            echo "⏭️ Deployment: SKIPPED (not main branch or tests failed)"
          else
            echo "❌ Deployment: FAILED"
          fi

content.text:
## Analysis Summary

Based on my investigation of the GitHub Actions logs and your repository configuration, I can identify the exact issue with your Vercel deployment:

### **Root Cause: Health Check Failure**

The deployment actually **succeeded** - Vercel deployed your application to `https://cads-research-visualization-kf3k1a8up.vercel.app`, but the **health check step failed**.

### **Key Issues Identified:**

1. **URL Mismatch**: The health check is testing `${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}` (which is a hardcoded URL in your secrets), but the actual deployment URL is dynamically generated by Vercel as `https://cads-research-visualization-kf3k1a8up.vercel.app`.

2. **Static vs Dynamic URLs**: Your workflow expects a predictable URL from secrets, but Vercel generates unique deployment URLs each time you create a "fresh" project (which your workflow does by unsetting ORG_ID and PROJECT_ID).

3. **30-second Wait May Be Insufficient**: The health check waits 30 seconds, but sometimes Vercel deployments take longer to fully propagate.

4. **Git Submodule Warning**: There's also a git warning about `backup_reorganization_20250820_032520` submodule, but this doesn't cause the failure.

### **The Specific Failure Point:**
```bash
curl -f -s "${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}" > /dev/null || exit 1
```
This fails because `VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL` secret points to a different URL than where Vercel actually deployed.

input.plan:
## Fix Vercel Deployment Health Check Issues

### Problem Analysis
- Vercel deployment succeeds but health check fails
- URL mismatch: hardcoded `VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL` secret vs dynamic Vercel-generated URLs
- Health check tests wrong URL causing pipeline failure

### Solution Plan

1. **Update CI workflow to capture dynamic deployment URL**:
   - Parse Vercel CLI output to extract the actual deployment URL
   - Store it as environment variable for health check
   - Remove dependency on hardcoded `VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL` secret

2. **Fix health check logic**:
   - Increase wait time from 30 to 60 seconds for deployment propagation
   - Use the dynamically captured URL instead of secret
   - Add retry logic for more robust health checking

3. **Clean up git submodule warning**:
   - Remove the problematic `backup_reorganization_20250820_032520` entry from git

4. **Optional: Simplify deployment approach**:
   - Keep using existing Vercel project instead of creating fresh ones
   - Use proper ORG_ID and PROJECT_ID for consistent URLs

### Files to Modify
- `.github/workflows/ci.yml` - Update deployment and health check steps
- Remove git submodule reference if needed

## Fix Vercel Deployment + Integrate Sentry Monitoring

### Problem Analysis
- Vercel deployment succeeds but health check fails due to URL mismatch
- Need robust error monitoring with Sentry integration
- Want consistent deployment URLs using existing Vercel project

### Solution Plan

**Phase 1: Fix Vercel Deployment Issues**
1. **Update CI workflow to use existing Vercel project**:
   - Keep `VERCEL_ORG_ID` and `VERCEL_PROJECT_ID` for consistent URLs
   - Remove the "fresh project" approach that creates random URLs
   - Parse Vercel CLI output to capture actual deployment URL

2. **Improve health check robustness**:
   - Increase wait time from 30 to 60 seconds
   - Add retry logic with exponential backoff
   - Test both main page and critical endpoints
   - Use captured URL instead of hardcoded secret

3. **Clean up git issues**:
   - Remove problematic `backup_reorganization_20250820_032520` submodule reference

**Phase 2: Integrate Sentry Monitoring**
4. **Add Sentry SDK to frontend**:
   - Install Sentry JavaScript SDK
   - Configure error tracking, performance monitoring
   - Add user context and custom tags
   - Set up source maps for better debugging

5. **Add Sentry to CI/CD pipeline**:
   - Create Sentry release tracking
   - Upload source maps automatically
   - Add deployment notifications to Sentry
   - Configure alerts for deployment issues

6. **Environment-specific Sentry setup**:
   - Development: Verbose logging, all errors
   - Production: Filtered errors, performance tracking
   - Staging: Full monitoring with test data context

### Files to Modify
- `.github/workflows/ci.yml` - Fix deployment + add Sentry steps
- `visuals/public/app.js` - Add Sentry SDK integration
- `visuals/public/index.html` - Sentry initialization
- `package.json` - Add Sentry dependencies (if using npm)
- New: `.sentryclirc` - Sentry CLI configuration
- New: `sentry.properties` - Sentry project configuration

### Sentry Portal Setup Process
Based on your previous Dashboard repo experience:

1. **Create new Sentry project**:
   - Navigate to Sentry dashboard
   - Create project: "CADS-Visualizer" (JavaScript/Vanilla JS)
   - Copy DSN for configuration

2. **Configure GitHub integration**:
   - Add Sentry GitHub app to repository
   - Set up commit tracking and release deployment
   - Configure issue linking between GitHub and Sentry

3. **Set up GitHub Secrets**:
   - `SENTRY_DSN` - Project DSN from Sentry dashboard
   - `SENTRY_AUTH_TOKEN` - Personal auth token for CLI
   - `SENTRY_ORG` - Your organization slug
   - `SENTRY_PROJECT` - Project slug (cads-visualizer)

4. **Configure alerts and notifications**:
   - Set up Slack/email alerts for new errors
   - Configure performance degradation alerts
   - Set up daily/weekly error summaries

This approach will give you both reliable deployments and comprehensive error monitoring.

input.new_string:
- name: Deploy to Vercel
        run: |
          echo "🚀 Starting Vercel deployment..."
          
          # Verify required environment variables
          if [ -z "$VERCEL_TOKEN" ]; then
            echo "❌ VERCEL_TOKEN is not set"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          echo "✅ Vercel token is set"
          echo "🔧 Using existing Vercel project for consistent URLs..."
          
          # Deploy to existing project with proper configuration
          echo "🚀 Deploying to existing cads-research project..."
          
          # Capture the deployment URL from Vercel output
          DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT=$(vercel --prod --token "$VERCEL_TOKEN" --yes 2>&1)
          echo "$DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT"
          
          # Extract the production URL from the output
          DEPLOYMENT_URL=$(echo "$DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT" | grep -E "https://.*\.vercel\.app" | tail -1 | awk '{print $1}')
          
          if [ -z "$DEPLOYMENT_URL" ]; then
            echo "❌ Failed to extract deployment URL from Vercel output"
            echo "Vercel output was:"
            echo "$DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          echo "✅ Deployment successful!"
          echo "📍 Deployment URL: $DEPLOYMENT_URL"
          
          # Save URL for health check
          echo "DEPLOYMENT_URL=$DEPLOYMENT_URL" >> $GITHUB_ENV
        env:
          VERCEL_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN }}
          VERCEL_ORG_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_ORG_ID }}
          VERCEL_PROJECT_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_PROJECT_ID }}

toolUseResult.originalFile:
name: CI/CD Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

env:
  NODE_VERSION: '18'
  PYTHON_VERSION: '3.9'

jobs:
  test:
    name: Run Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    environment: cads-research
    
    services:
      postgres:
        image: postgres:14
        env:
          POSTGRES_USER: postgres
          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres
          POSTGRES_DB: test_db
        options: >-
          --health-cmd pg_isready
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 5432:5432

    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v4
        with:
          python-version: ${{ env.PYTHON_VERSION }}
          cache: 'pip'
          cache-dependency-path: 'requirements.txt'

      - name: Set up Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}

      - name: Install Python dependencies
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          pip install -r requirements.txt

      - name: Debug environment
        run: |
          echo "Python version: $(python --version)"
          echo "Current directory: $(pwd)"
          echo "Requirements file check:"
          ls -la requirements.txt
          echo "CADS directory check:"
          ls -la cads/ || echo "CADS directory structure may differ in CI"
          echo "Project structure:"
          ls -la

      - name: Set up test environment variables
        run: |
          echo "DATABASE_URL=postgresql://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/test_db" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "SUPABASE_URL=${{ secrets.DATABASE_URL }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "OPENALEX_EMAIL=test@example.com" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "GROQ_API_KEY=${{ secrets.GROQ_API_KEY }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "CI=true" >> $GITHUB_ENV

      - name: Generate comprehensive test data
        run: |
          echo "🔧 Generating comprehensive test data for CI environment..."
          python3 scripts/ci/generate_test_data.py
          
          echo "📋 Verifying generated files..."
          ls -la data/processed/
          ls -la visuals/public/data/
          
          echo "📊 File sizes:"
          find data/ visuals/public/data/ -name "*.json" -exec ls -lh {} \;
          echo "📦 Compressed files:"
          find data/ visuals/public/data/ -name "*.gz" -exec ls -lh {} \;
          
          echo "✅ Comprehensive test data generated successfully"

      - name: Run comprehensive test suite
        run: |
          chmod +x .github/scripts/run-tests.sh
          ./.github/scripts/run-tests.sh

  deploy:
    name: Deploy to Vercel
    needs: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    environment: cads-research
    # Only deploy if tests pass AND we're on main branch AND it's a push (not PR)
    if: success() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Verify test job succeeded
        run: |
          echo "✅ All tests passed successfully - proceeding with deployment"
          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"

      - name: Debug Vercel configuration
        run: |
          echo "🔍 Verifying Vercel environment variables..."
          echo "VERCEL_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "VERCEL_ORG_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_ORG_ID != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "VERCEL_PROJECT_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_PROJECT_ID != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "Environment: cads-research"

      - name: Install Vercel CLI
        run: npm install -g vercel@latest

      - name: Deploy to Vercel
        run: |
          echo "🚀 Starting Vercel deployment..."
          
          # Verify required environment variables
          if [ -z "$VERCEL_TOKEN" ]; then
            echo "❌ VERCEL_TOKEN is not set"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          echo "✅ Vercel token is set"
          
          # Deploy to create fresh cads-research project 
          echo "🚀 Creating fresh cads-research project..."
          
          # Remove any existing .vercel directory to ensure clean deployment
          rm -rf .vercel
          
          # Unset the problematic environment variables
          unset VERCEL_ORG_ID
          unset VERCEL_PROJECT_ID
          
          # Deploy with specific project name - this will create the project
          echo "🚀 Deploying fresh cads-research project..."
          vercel --prod --token "$VERCEL_TOKEN" --yes
        env:
          VERCEL_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN }}

      - name: Health check
        run: |
          echo "🏥 Running post-deployment health check..."
          echo "Checking URL: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}"
          
          # Wait for deployment to be fully available
          sleep 30
          
          # Test main page
          echo "Testing main page..."
          curl -f -s "${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}" > /dev/null || exit 1
          
          # Test data endpoint
          echo "Testing data endpoint..."
          curl -f -s "${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}/data/visualization-data.json" > /dev/null || exit 1
          
          echo "✅ Deployment health check passed"

      - name: Deployment success notification
        run: |
          echo "🚀 Deployment completed successfully!"
          echo "URL: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}"

  # This job runs when tests fail to provide clear feedback
  test-failure-notification:
    name: Test Failure Notification
    needs: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: failure() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    
    steps:
      - name: Test failure notification
        run: |
          echo "❌ Tests failed - deployment blocked!"
          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"
          echo "Please fix the failing tests before deployment can proceed."
          exit 1

  # Summary job that always runs to provide final status
  summary:
    name: Pipeline Summary
    needs: [test, deploy]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: always()
    
    steps:
      - name: Pipeline summary
        run: |
          echo "📋 CI/CD Pipeline Summary"
          echo "======================="
          echo "Test Status: ${{ needs.test.result }}"
          echo "Deploy Status: ${{ needs.deploy.result }}"
          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.test.result }}" == "success" ]]; then
            echo "✅ Tests: PASSED"
          else
            echo "❌ Tests: FAILED"
          fi
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.deploy.result }}" == "success" ]]; then
            echo "✅ Deployment: COMPLETED"
          elif [[ "${{ needs.deploy.result }}" == "skipped" ]]; then
            echo "⏭️ Deployment: SKIPPED (not main branch or tests failed)"
          else
            echo "❌ Deployment: FAILED"
          fi

input.new_string:
- name: Health check
        run: |
          echo "🏥 Running post-deployment health check..."
          echo "📍 Testing URL: $DEPLOYMENT_URL"
          
          # Function to test an endpoint with retry logic
          test_endpoint() {
            local url="$1"
            local description="$2"
            local max_attempts=5
            local wait_time=15
            
            for attempt in $(seq 1 $max_attempts); do
              echo "🔍 Testing $description (attempt $attempt/$max_attempts)..."
              
              if curl -f -s -w "HTTP %{http_code} | Size: %{size_download} bytes | Time: %{time_total}s\n" "$url" > /dev/null; then
                echo "✅ $description - SUCCESS"
                return 0
              else
                echo "❌ $description - Failed (attempt $attempt/$max_attempts)"
                if [ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]; then
                  echo "⏳ Waiting ${wait_time}s before retry..."
                  sleep $wait_time
                fi
              fi
            done
            
            echo "💥 $description - All attempts failed"
            return 1
          }
          
          # Wait for initial deployment propagation
          echo "⏳ Waiting 60 seconds for deployment to fully propagate..."
          sleep 60
          
          # Test main page
          test_endpoint "$DEPLOYMENT_URL" "Main page"
          
          # Test data endpoint
          test_endpoint "$DEPLOYMENT_URL/data/visualization-data.json" "Data endpoint"
          
          # Test static assets
          test_endpoint "$DEPLOYMENT_URL/app.js" "JavaScript assets"
          
          echo "🎉 All health checks passed successfully!"
          echo "🚀 Deployment is fully operational at: $DEPLOYMENT_URL"

              if curl -f -s -w "HTTP %{http_code} | Size: %{size_download} bytes | Time: %{time_total}s\n" "$url" > /dev/null; then
                echo "✅ $description - SUCCESS"
                return 0
              else
                echo "❌ $description - Failed (attempt $attempt/$max_attempts)"
                if [ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]; then
                  echo "⏳ Waiting ${wait_time}s before retry..."
                  sleep $wait_time
                fi
              fi
            done
            
            echo "💥 $description - All attempts failed"
            return 1
          }
          
          # Wait for initial deployment propagation
          echo "⏳ Waiting 60 seconds for deployment to fully propagate..."
          sleep 60
          
          # Test main page
          test_endpoint "$DEPLOYMENT_URL" "Main page"
          
          # Test data endpoint
          test_endpoint "$DEPLOYMENT_URL/data/visualization-data.json" "Data endpoint"
          
          # Test static assets
          test_endpoint "$DEPLOYMENT_URL/app.js" "JavaScript assets"
          
          echo "🎉 All health checks passed successfully!"
          echo "🚀 Deployment is fully operational at: $DEPLOYMENT_URL"

name: CI/CD Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

env:
  NODE_VERSION: '18'
  PYTHON_VERSION: '3.9'

jobs:
  test:
    name: Run Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    environment: cads-research
    
    services:
      postgres:
        image: postgres:14
        env:
          POSTGRES_USER: postgres
          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres
          POSTGRES_DB: test_db
        options: >-
          --health-cmd pg_isready
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 5432:5432

    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v4
        with:
          python-version: ${{ env.PYTHON_VERSION }}
          cache: 'pip'
          cache-dependency-path: 'requirements.txt'

      - name: Set up Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}

      - name: Install Python dependencies
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          pip install -r requirements.txt

      - name: Debug environment
        run: |
          echo "Python version: $(python --version)"
          echo "Current directory: $(pwd)"
          echo "Requirements file check:"
          ls -la requirements.txt
          echo "CADS directory check:"
          ls -la cads/ || echo "CADS directory structure may differ in CI"
          echo "Project structure:"
          ls -la

      - name: Set up test environment variables
        run: |
          echo "DATABASE_URL=postgresql://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/test_db" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "SUPABASE_URL=${{ secrets.DATABASE_URL }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "OPENALEX_EMAIL=test@example.com" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "GROQ_API_KEY=${{ secrets.GROQ_API_KEY }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "CI=true" >> $GITHUB_ENV

      - name: Generate comprehensive test data
        run: |
          echo "🔧 Generating comprehensive test data for CI environment..."
          python3 scripts/ci/generate_test_data.py
          
          echo "📋 Verifying generated files..."
          ls -la data/processed/
          ls -la visuals/public/data/
          
          echo "📊 File sizes:"
          find data/ visuals/public/data/ -name "*.json" -exec ls -lh {} \;
          echo "📦 Compressed files:"
          find data/ visuals/public/data/ -name "*.gz" -exec ls -lh {} \;
          
          echo "✅ Comprehensive test data generated successfully"

      - name: Run comprehensive test suite
        run: |
          chmod +x .github/scripts/run-tests.sh
          ./.github/scripts/run-tests.sh

  deploy:
    name: Deploy to Vercel
    needs: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    environment: cads-research
    # Only deploy if tests pass AND we're on main branch AND it's a push (not PR)
    if: success() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Verify test job succeeded
        run: |
          echo "✅ All tests passed successfully - proceeding with deployment"
          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"

      - name: Debug Vercel configuration
        run: |
          echo "🔍 Verifying Vercel environment variables..."
          echo "VERCEL_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "VERCEL_ORG_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_ORG_ID != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "VERCEL_PROJECT_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_PROJECT_ID != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "Environment: cads-research"

      - name: Install Vercel CLI
        run: npm install -g vercel@latest

      - name: Deploy to Vercel
        run: |
          echo "🚀 Starting Vercel deployment..."
          
          # Verify required environment variables
          if [ -z "$VERCEL_TOKEN" ]; then
            echo "❌ VERCEL_TOKEN is not set"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          echo "✅ Vercel token is set"
          echo "🔧 Using existing Vercel project for consistent URLs..."
          
          # Deploy to existing project with proper configuration
          echo "🚀 Deploying to existing cads-research project..."
          
          # Capture the deployment URL from Vercel output
          DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT=$(vercel --prod --token "$VERCEL_TOKEN" --yes 2>&1)
          echo "$DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT"
          
          # Extract the production URL from the output
          DEPLOYMENT_URL=$(echo "$DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT" | grep -E "https://.*\.vercel\.app" | tail -1 | awk '{print $1}')
          
          if [ -z "$DEPLOYMENT_URL" ]; then
            echo "❌ Failed to extract deployment URL from Vercel output"
            echo "Vercel output was:"
            echo "$DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          echo "✅ Deployment successful!"
          echo "📍 Deployment URL: $DEPLOYMENT_URL"
          
          # Save URL for health check
          echo "DEPLOYMENT_URL=$DEPLOYMENT_URL" >> $GITHUB_ENV
        env:
          VERCEL_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN }}
          VERCEL_ORG_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_ORG_ID }}
          VERCEL_PROJECT_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_PROJECT_ID }}

      - name: Health check
        run: |
          echo "🏥 Running post-deployment health check..."
          echo "Checking URL: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}"
          
          # Wait for deployment to be fully available
          sleep 30
          
          # Test main page
          echo "Testing main page..."
          curl -f -s "${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}" > /dev/null || exit 1
          
          # Test data endpoint
          echo "Testing data endpoint..."
          curl -f -s "${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}/data/visualization-data.json" > /dev/null || exit 1
          
          echo "✅ Deployment health check passed"

      - name: Deployment success notification
        run: |
          echo "🚀 Deployment completed successfully!"
          echo "URL: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}"

  # This job runs when tests fail to provide clear feedback
  test-failure-notification:
    name: Test Failure Notification
    needs: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: failure() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    
    steps:
      - name: Test failure notification
        run: |
          echo "❌ Tests failed - deployment blocked!"
          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"
          echo "Please fix the failing tests before deployment can proceed."
          exit 1

  # Summary job that always runs to provide final status
  summary:
    name: Pipeline Summary
    needs: [test, deploy]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: always()
    
    steps:
      - name: Pipeline summary
        run: |
          echo "📋 CI/CD Pipeline Summary"
          echo "======================="
          echo "Test Status: ${{ needs.test.result }}"
          echo "Deploy Status: ${{ needs.deploy.result }}"
          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.test.result }}" == "success" ]]; then
            echo "✅ Tests: PASSED"
          else
            echo "❌ Tests: FAILED"
          fi
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.deploy.result }}" == "success" ]]; then
            echo "✅ Deployment: COMPLETED"
          elif [[ "${{ needs.deploy.result }}" == "skipped" ]]; then
            echo "⏭️ Deployment: SKIPPED (not main branch or tests failed)"
          else
            echo "❌ Deployment: FAILED"
          fi

      - name: Generate comprehensive test data
        run: |
          echo "🔧 Generating comprehensive test data for CI environment..."
          python3 scripts/ci/generate_test_data.py
          
          echo "📋 Verifying generated files..."
          ls -la data/processed/
          ls -la visuals/public/data/
          
          echo "📊 File sizes:"
          find data/ visuals/public/data/ -name "*.json" -exec ls -lh {} \;
          echo "📦 Compressed files:"
          find data/ visuals/public/data/ -name "*.gz" -exec ls -lh {} \;
          
          echo "✅ Comprehensive test data generated successfully"

      - name: Run comprehensive test suite
        run: |
          chmod +x .github/scripts/run-tests.sh
          ./.github/scripts/run-tests.sh

  deploy:
    name: Deploy to Vercel
    needs: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    environment: cads-research
    # Only deploy if tests pass AND we're on main branch AND it's a push (not PR)
    if: success() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Verify test job succeeded
        run: |
          echo "✅ All tests passed successfully - proceeding with deployment"
          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"

      - name: Debug Vercel configuration
        run: |

          echo "VERCEL_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "VERCEL_ORG_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_ORG_ID != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "VERCEL_PROJECT_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_PROJECT_ID != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "Environment: cads-research"

      - name: Install Vercel CLI
        run: npm install -g vercel@latest

      - name: Deploy to Vercel
        run: |
          echo "🚀 Starting Vercel deployment..."
          
          # Verify required environment variables
          if [ -z "$VERCEL_TOKEN" ]; then
            echo "❌ VERCEL_TOKEN is not set"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          echo "✅ Vercel token is set"
          echo "🔧 Using existing Vercel project for consistent URLs..."
          
          # Deploy to existing project with proper configuration
          echo "🚀 Deploying to existing cads-research project..."

          DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT=$(vercel --prod --token "$VERCEL_TOKEN" --yes 2>&1)
          echo "$DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT"

      - name: Health check
        run: |
          echo "🏥 Running post-deployment health check..."
          echo "📍 Testing URL: $DEPLOYMENT_URL"
          
          # Function to test an endpoint with retry logic
          test_endpoint() {
            local url="$1"
            local description="$2"
            local max_attempts=5
            local wait_time=15
            
            for attempt in $(seq 1 $max_attempts); do
              echo "🔍 Testing $description (attempt $attempt/$max_attempts)..."
              
              if curl -f -s -w "HTTP %{http_code} | Size: %{size_download} bytes | Time: %{time_total}s\n" "$url" > /dev/null; then
                echo "✅ $description - SUCCESS"
                return 0
              else
                echo "❌ $description - Failed (attempt $attempt/$max_attempts)"
                if [ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]; then
                  echo "⏳ Waiting ${wait_time}s before retry..."
                  sleep $wait_time
                fi
              fi
            done
            
            echo "💥 $description - All attempts failed"
            return 1
          }
          
          # Wait for initial deployment propagation
          echo "⏳ Waiting 60 seconds for deployment to fully propagate..."
          sleep 60
          
          # Test main page
          test_endpoint "$DEPLOYMENT_URL" "Main page"
          
          # Test data endpoint
          test_endpoint "$DEPLOYMENT_URL/data/visualization-data.json" "Data endpoint"
          
          # Test static assets
          test_endpoint "$DEPLOYMENT_URL/app.js" "JavaScript assets"
          
          echo "🎉 All health checks passed successfully!"
          echo "🚀 Deployment is fully operational at: $DEPLOYMENT_URL"

      - name: Deployment success notification
        run: |
          echo "🚀 Deployment completed successfully!"
          echo "URL: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_DEPLOYMENT_URL }}"

  # This job runs when tests fail to provide clear feedback
  test-failure-notification:
    name: Test Failure Notification
    needs: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: failure() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    
    steps:
      - name: Test failure notification
        run: |
          echo "❌ Tests failed - deployment blocked!"
          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"
          echo "Please fix the failing tests before deployment can proceed."
          exit 1

  # Summary job that always runs to provide final status
  summary:
    name: Pipeline Summary
    needs: [test, deploy]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: always()
    
    steps:
      - name: Pipeline summary
        run: |
          echo "📋 CI/CD Pipeline Summary"
          echo "======================="
          echo "Test Status: ${{ needs.test.result }}"
          echo "Deploy Status: ${{ needs.deploy.result }}"
          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.test.result }}" == "success" ]]; then
            echo "✅ Tests: PASSED"
          else
            echo "❌ Tests: FAILED"
          fi
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.deploy.result }}" == "success" ]]; then
            echo "✅ Deployment: COMPLETED"
          elif [[ "${{ needs.deploy.result }}" == "skipped" ]]; then
            echo "⏭️ Deployment: SKIPPED (not main branch or tests failed)"
          else
            echo "❌ Deployment: FAILED"
          fi

// CADS Research Visualization Application
console.log('🎯 CADS Research Visualization - Initializing...');

// Application state
const app = {
    data: null,
    filteredData: null,
    searchIndex: null,
    clusterThemes: null,
    clusterCenters: null,
    deckgl: null,
    isLoading: true,
    currentZoom: 8,
    labelSizeCache: new Map(), // Cache for calculated label sizes
    
    // Performance monitoring
    performance: {
        loadStartTime: performance.now(),
        dataLoadTime: null,
        renderTime: null,
        interactionCount: 0,
        errorCount: 0
    },
    
    // Filter state tracking
    filterState: {
        researcher: '',
        themes: new Set(),
        keywords: [],
        keywordsLogic: 'AND',
        year: 2010
    },

    // UI elements
    elements: {
        loading: document.getElementById('loading'),
        loadingProgress: document.getElementById('loading-progress'),
        errorMessage: document.getElementById('error-message'),
        errorDetails: document.getElementById('error-details'),
        mapContainer: document.getElementById('map-container'),
        uiPanel: document.getElementById('ui-panel'),
        // panelToggle removed - sidebar is now permanent
        researcherInput: document.getElementById('researcher-input'),
        themeChecklist: document.getElementById('theme-checklist'),
        keywordsInput: document.getElementById('keywords-input'),
        addKeywordBtn: document.getElementById('add-keyword-btn'),
        keywordsLogic: document.getElementById('keywords-logic'),
        keywordsTags: document.getElementById('keywords-tags'),
        yearFilter: document.getElementById('year-filter'),
        yearDisplay: document.getElementById('year-display'),

file.content:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">

<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>CADS Research Visualization - Texas State University (Live)</title>
    <meta name="description" content="Interactive visualization of Texas State University CADS research landscape">
    <link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="cads_logo.png">

    <!-- Sentry Error Tracking -->
    <script src="https://js.sentry-cdn.com/859c6ba713b1af67c44c0b217300cd9a.min.js" crossorigin="anonymous"></script>

    <!-- Vercel Analytics -->
    <script>
        window.va = window.va || function () { (window.vaq = window.vaq || []).push(arguments); };
    </script>
    <script defer src="/_vercel/insights/script.js"></script>

    <!-- Preload critical data (compressed versions) -->
    <link rel="preload" href="/data/visualization-data.json.gz" as="fetch" type="application/json">
    <link rel="preload" href="/data/search-index.json.gz" as="fetch" type="application/json">
    <link rel="preload" href="/data/cluster_themes.json.gz" as="fetch" type="application/json">
    <link rel="preload" href="/data/clustering_results.json.gz" as="fetch" type="application/json">

    <style>
        /* Reset and base styles */
        * {
            box-sizing: border-box;
        }

name: CI/CD Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

env:
  NODE_VERSION: '18'
  PYTHON_VERSION: '3.9'

jobs:
  test:
    name: Run Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    environment: cads-research
    
    services:
      postgres:
        image: postgres:14
        env:
          POSTGRES_USER: postgres
          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres
          POSTGRES_DB: test_db
        options: >-
          --health-cmd pg_isready
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 5432:5432

    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v4
        with:
          python-version: ${{ env.PYTHON_VERSION }}
          cache: 'pip'
          cache-dependency-path: 'requirements.txt'

      - name: Set up Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}

      - name: Install Python dependencies
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          pip install -r requirements.txt

      - name: Debug environment
        run: |
          echo "Python version: $(python --version)"
          echo "Current directory: $(pwd)"
          echo "Requirements file check:"
          ls -la requirements.txt
          echo "CADS directory check:"
          ls -la cads/ || echo "CADS directory structure may differ in CI"
          echo "Project structure:"
          ls -la

      - name: Set up test environment variables
        run: |
          echo "DATABASE_URL=postgresql://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/test_db" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "SUPABASE_URL=${{ secrets.DATABASE_URL }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "OPENALEX_EMAIL=test@example.com" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "GROQ_API_KEY=${{ secrets.GROQ_API_KEY }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "CI=true" >> $GITHUB_ENV

      - name: Generate comprehensive test data
        run: |
          echo "🔧 Generating comprehensive test data for CI environment..."
          python3 scripts/ci/generate_test_data.py
          
          echo "📋 Verifying generated files..."
          ls -la data/processed/
          ls -la visuals/public/data/
          
          echo "📊 File sizes:"
          find data/ visuals/public/data/ -name "*.json" -exec ls -lh {} \;
          echo "📦 Compressed files:"
          find data/ visuals/public/data/ -name "*.gz" -exec ls -lh {} \;
          
          echo "✅ Comprehensive test data generated successfully"

      - name: Run comprehensive test suite
        run: |
          chmod +x .github/scripts/run-tests.sh
          ./.github/scripts/run-tests.sh

  deploy:
    name: Deploy to Vercel
    needs: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    environment: cads-research
    # Only deploy if tests pass AND we're on main branch AND it's a push (not PR)
    if: success() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Verify test job succeeded
        run: |
          echo "✅ All tests passed successfully - proceeding with deployment"
          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"

      - name: Debug Vercel configuration
        run: |
          echo "🔍 Verifying Vercel environment variables..."
          echo "VERCEL_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "VERCEL_ORG_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_ORG_ID != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "VERCEL_PROJECT_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_PROJECT_ID != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "Environment: cads-research"

      - name: Install Vercel CLI
        run: npm install -g vercel@latest

      - name: Deploy to Vercel
        run: |
          echo "🚀 Starting Vercel deployment..."
          
          # Verify required environment variables
          if [ -z "$VERCEL_TOKEN" ]; then
            echo "❌ VERCEL_TOKEN is not set"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          echo "✅ Vercel token is set"
          echo "🔧 Using existing Vercel project for consistent URLs..."
          
          # Deploy to existing project with proper configuration
          echo "🚀 Deploying to existing cads-research project..."
          
          # Capture the deployment URL from Vercel output
          DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT=$(vercel --prod --token "$VERCEL_TOKEN" --yes 2>&1)
          echo "$DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT"
          
          # Extract the production URL from the output
          DEPLOYMENT_URL=$(echo "$DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT" | grep -E "https://.*\.vercel\.app" | tail -1 | awk '{print $1}')
          
          if [ -z "$DEPLOYMENT_URL" ]; then
            echo "❌ Failed to extract deployment URL from Vercel output"
            echo "Vercel output was:"
            echo "$DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          echo "✅ Deployment successful!"
          echo "📍 Deployment URL: $DEPLOYMENT_URL"
          
          # Save URL for health check
          echo "DEPLOYMENT_URL=$DEPLOYMENT_URL" >> $GITHUB_ENV
        env:
          VERCEL_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN }}
          VERCEL_ORG_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_ORG_ID }}
          VERCEL_PROJECT_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_PROJECT_ID }}

      - name: Health check
        run: |
          echo "🏥 Running post-deployment health check..."
          echo "📍 Testing URL: $DEPLOYMENT_URL"
          
          # Function to test an endpoint with retry logic
          test_endpoint() {
            local url="$1"
            local description="$2"
            local max_attempts=5
            local wait_time=15
            
            for attempt in $(seq 1 $max_attempts); do
              echo "🔍 Testing $description (attempt $attempt/$max_attempts)..."
              
              if curl -f -s -w "HTTP %{http_code} | Size: %{size_download} bytes | Time: %{time_total}s\n" "$url" > /dev/null; then
                echo "✅ $description - SUCCESS"
                return 0
              else
                echo "❌ $description - Failed (attempt $attempt/$max_attempts)"
                if [ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]; then
                  echo "⏳ Waiting ${wait_time}s before retry..."
                  sleep $wait_time
                fi
              fi
            done
            
            echo "💥 $description - All attempts failed"
            return 1
          }
          
          # Wait for initial deployment propagation
          echo "⏳ Waiting 60 seconds for deployment to fully propagate..."
          sleep 60
          
          # Test main page
          test_endpoint "$DEPLOYMENT_URL" "Main page"
          
          # Test data endpoint
          test_endpoint "$DEPLOYMENT_URL/data/visualization-data.json" "Data endpoint"
          
          # Test static assets
          test_endpoint "$DEPLOYMENT_URL/app.js" "JavaScript assets"
          
          echo "🎉 All health checks passed successfully!"
          echo "🚀 Deployment is fully operational at: $DEPLOYMENT_URL"

      - name: Deployment success notification
        run: |
          echo "🚀 Deployment completed successfully!"
          echo "📍 Live URL: $DEPLOYMENT_URL"
          echo "🎯 All health checks passed - application is fully operational"

  # This job runs when tests fail to provide clear feedback
  test-failure-notification:
    name: Test Failure Notification
    needs: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: failure() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    
    steps:
      - name: Test failure notification
        run: |
          echo "❌ Tests failed - deployment blocked!"
          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"
          echo "Please fix the failing tests before deployment can proceed."
          exit 1

  # Summary job that always runs to provide final status
  summary:
    name: Pipeline Summary
    needs: [test, deploy]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: always()
    
    steps:
      - name: Pipeline summary
        run: |
          echo "📋 CI/CD Pipeline Summary"
          echo "======================="
          echo "Test Status: ${{ needs.test.result }}"
          echo "Deploy Status: ${{ needs.deploy.result }}"
          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.test.result }}" == "success" ]]; then
            echo "✅ Tests: PASSED"
          else
            echo "❌ Tests: FAILED"
          fi
          
          if [[ "${{ needs.deploy.result }}" == "success" ]]; then
            echo "✅ Deployment: COMPLETED"
          elif [[ "${{ needs.deploy.result }}" == "skipped" ]]; then
            echo "⏭️ Deployment: SKIPPED (not main branch or tests failed)"
          else
            echo "❌ Deployment: FAILED"
          fi

content.text: Now let me add the Sentry release tracking step after the health check:

input.old_string:
echo "🎉 All health checks passed successfully!"
          echo "🚀 Deployment is fully operational at: $DEPLOYMENT_URL"

      - name: Deployment success notification
input.new_string:
echo "🎉 All health checks passed successfully!"
          echo "🚀 Deployment is fully operational at: $DEPLOYMENT_URL"

      - name: Sentry Release Tracking
        run: |
          echo "📊 Setting up Sentry release tracking..."
          
          # Create release identifier using commit SHA and timestamp
          SENTRY_RELEASE="${{ github.sha }}-$(date +%s)"
          echo "SENTRY_RELEASE=$SENTRY_RELEASE" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          
          # Create Sentry release
          echo "🚀 Creating Sentry release: $SENTRY_RELEASE"
          sentry-cli releases new "$SENTRY_RELEASE" --finalize
          
          # Set release metadata
          sentry-cli releases set-commits "$SENTRY_RELEASE" --auto
          
          # Associate deployment with release
          echo "🌍 Creating deployment record in Sentry..."
          sentry-cli releases deploys "$SENTRY_RELEASE" new \
            --env production \
            --url "$DEPLOYMENT_URL" \
            --name "GitHub Actions Deployment"
          
          echo "✅ Sentry release tracking configured successfully!"
          echo "📊 Release: $SENTRY_RELEASE"
          echo "🔗 View in Sentry: https://sentry.io/organizations/${{ secrets.SENTRY_ORG }}/releases/$SENTRY_RELEASE/"
        env:
          SENTRY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.SENTRY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
          SENTRY_ORG: ${{ secrets.SENTRY_ORG }}
          SENTRY_PROJECT: ${{ secrets.SENTRY_PROJECT }}
        continue-on-error: true

      - name: Deployment success notification

name: CI/CD Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

env:
  NODE_VERSION: '18'
  PYTHON_VERSION: '3.9'

jobs:
  test:
    name: Run Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    environment: cads-research
    
    services:
      postgres:
        image: postgres:14
        env:
          POSTGRES_USER: postgres
          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres
          POSTGRES_DB: test_db
        options: >-
          --health-cmd pg_isready
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 5432:5432

    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v4
        with:
          python-version: ${{ env.PYTHON_VERSION }}
          cache: 'pip'
          cache-dependency-path: 'requirements.txt'

      - name: Set up Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}

      - name: Install Python dependencies
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          pip install -r requirements.txt

      - name: Debug environment
        run: |
          echo "Python version: $(python --version)"
          echo "Current directory: $(pwd)"
          echo "Requirements file check:"
          ls -la requirements.txt
          echo "CADS directory check:"
          ls -la cads/ || echo "CADS directory structure may differ in CI"
          echo "Project structure:"
          ls -la

      - name: Set up test environment variables
        run: |
          echo "DATABASE_URL=postgresql://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/test_db" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "SUPABASE_URL=${{ secrets.DATABASE_URL }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "OPENALEX_EMAIL=test@example.com" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "GROQ_API_KEY=${{ secrets.GROQ_API_KEY }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "CI=true" >> $GITHUB_ENV

      - name: Generate comprehensive test data
        run: |
          echo "🔧 Generating comprehensive test data for CI environment..."
          python3 scripts/ci/generate_test_data.py
          
          echo "📋 Verifying generated files..."
          ls -la data/processed/
          ls -la visuals/public/data/
          
          echo "📊 File sizes:"
          find data/ visuals/public/data/ -name "*.json" -exec ls -lh {} \;
          echo "📦 Compressed files:"
          find data/ visuals/public/data/ -name "*.gz" -exec ls -lh {} \;
          
          echo "✅ Comprehensive test data generated successfully"

      - name: Run comprehensive test suite
        run: |
          chmod +x .github/scripts/run-tests.sh
          ./.github/scripts/run-tests.sh

  deploy:
    name: Deploy to Vercel
    needs: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    environment: cads-research
    # Only deploy if tests pass AND we're on main branch AND it's a push (not PR)
    if: success() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Verify test job succeeded
        run: |
          echo "✅ All tests passed successfully - proceeding with deployment"
          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"

      - name: Debug Vercel configuration
        run: |
          echo "🔍 Verifying Vercel environment variables..."
          echo "VERCEL_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "VERCEL_ORG_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_ORG_ID != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "VERCEL_PROJECT_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_PROJECT_ID != '' && 'SET' || 'NOT SET' }}"
          echo "Environment: cads-research"

      - name: Install Vercel CLI
        run: npm install -g vercel@latest

      - name: Set up Node.js for Sentry
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}

      - name: Install Sentry CLI
        run: npm install -g @sentry/cli@latest

      - name: Deploy to Vercel
        run: |
          echo "🚀 Starting Vercel deployment..."
          
          # Verify required environment variables
          if [ -z "$VERCEL_TOKEN" ]; then
            echo "❌ VERCEL_TOKEN is not set"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          echo "✅ Vercel token is set"
          echo "🔧 Using existing Vercel project for consistent URLs..."
          
          # Deploy to existing project with proper configuration
          echo "🚀 Deploying to existing cads-research project..."
          
          # Capture the deployment URL from Vercel output
          DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT=$(vercel --prod --token "$VERCEL_TOKEN" --yes 2>&1)
          echo "$DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT"
          
          # Extract the production URL from the output
          DEPLOYMENT_URL=$(echo "$DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT" | grep -E "https://.*\.vercel\.app" | tail -1 | awk '{print $1}')
          
          if [ -z "$DEPLOYMENT_URL" ]; then
            echo "❌ Failed to extract deployment URL from Vercel output"
            echo "Vercel output was:"
            echo "$DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT"
            exit 1
          fi
          
          echo "✅ Deployment successful!"
          echo "📍 Deployment URL: $DEPLOYMENT_URL"
          
          # Save URL for health check
          echo "DEPLOYMENT_URL=$DEPLOYMENT_URL" >> $GITHUB_ENV
        env:
          VERCEL_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN }}
          VERCEL_ORG_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_ORG_ID }}
          VERCEL_PROJECT_ID: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_PROJECT_ID }}

      - name: Health check
        run: |
          echo "🏥 Running post-deployment health check..."
          echo "📍 Testing URL: $DEPLOYMENT_URL"
          
          # Function to test an endpoint with retry logic
          test_endpoint() {
            local url="$1"
            local description="$2"
            local max_attempts=5
            local wait_time=15
            
            for attempt in $(seq 1 $max_attempts); do
              echo "🔍 Testing $description (attempt $attempt/$max_attempts)..."
              
              if curl -f -s -w "HTTP %{http_code} | Size: %{size_download} bytes | Time: %{time_total}s\n" "$url" > /dev/null; then
                echo "✅ $description - SUCCESS"
                return 0
              else
                echo "❌ $description - Failed (attempt $attempt/$max_attempts)"
                if [ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]; then
                  echo "⏳ Waiting ${wait_time}s before retry..."
                  sleep $wait_time
                fi
              fi
            done
            
            echo "💥 $description - All attempts failed"
            return 1
          }
          
          # Wait for initial deployment propagation
          echo "⏳ Waiting 60 seconds for deployment to fully propagate..."
          sleep 60
          
          # Test main page
          test_endpoint "$DEPLOYMENT_URL" "Main page"
          
          # Test data endpoint
          test_endpoint "$DEPLOYMENT_URL/data/visualization-data.json" "Data endpoint"
          
          # Test static assets
          test_endpoint "$DEPLOYMENT_URL/app.js" "JavaScript assets"
          
          echo "🎉 All health checks passed successfully!"
          echo "🚀 Deployment is fully operational at: $DEPLOYMENT_URL"

      - name: Deployment success notification
        run: |
          echo "🚀 Deployment completed successfully!"
          echo "📍 Live URL: $DEPLOYMENT_URL"
          echo "🎯 All health checks passed - application is fully operational"

  # This job runs when tests fail to provide clear feedback
  test-failure-notification:
    name: Test Failure Notification
    needs: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: failure() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    
    steps:
      - name: Test failure notification
        run: |
          echo "❌ Tests failed - deployment blocked!"
          echo "Branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Event: ${{ github.event_name }}"
          echo "Please fix the failing tests before deployment can proceed."
          exit 1

  # Summary job that always runs to provide final status
  summary:
    name: Pipeline Summary
    needs: [test, deploy]
